description.narrative:
PLEASE REVIEW YOUR ANSWER AS THE QUESTION HAS BEEN CHANGED
The objective/purpose of this RBM TA as per the government’s request is to further build and strengthen the Government’s capacity, specifically, that of the Directorate of Primary Education (DPE) and the Ministry of Primary & Mass Education (MOPME) to operationalize and institutionalise the RBM approach under PEDP 3. The specific objectives are: i. report results from the implementation of the programme in a timely, clear and effective manner; ii. use of the information to feed into an evidence-based annual operational planning process and; iii) institutionalise the RBM approach at the central and local levels on a sustainable basis wherein the government can manage the process. Please see detailed TOR dated August 2012 ( uploaded) for specific tasks/results to achieve the objectives which will be monitored and reported by the Monitoring & Evaluation Division ( M&E Division) of the DPE through the Annual Sector Performance Reports based on the Annual School Census Reports, and the Disbursement Linked Indicators Reports. In conclusion, the above objectives based on the past inputs of the RBM-TA also indicated in the above TOR are in line with the intended results of PEDP 3, and are consistent with the Swedish strategy objectives for quality education for all children in Bangladesh with a focus on girls.

The PEDP 3 Results Based Management (RBM) Technical Assistance (TA)to the government's PEDP 2 and PEDP 3 so far has been provided by Sida to carry out the tasks of results reporting and evidence based planning in these programmes. The Sida contract C00952 for the above was completed October 2012, and the government has requested Sida for more RBMTA in PEDP 3 which will be done through a Sida-ADB Admin. Agr

description.narrative: The overall purpose of the technical assistance was to support the Directorate of Primary Education in implementation of the Third Primary Education Development Programme (PEDP 3) focusing on institutionalizing the Results-Based Management (RBM) approach. Results were achieved in the six main areas of focus. Notable among them are (1) strengthened Annual Primary School Census (ASPC) and Annual Sector Performance Report (ASPR)data analysis through extensive discussion with Monitoring and Evaluation and Infomation Management Division (IMD) statisticians on the formula for calculating PEPD3 (Key Perfomance Indicators) and Primary School Quality Level (PSQL); (2) Conducted extensive review of past ASPR reports. Based on the review and consultation with the M&E division, Annual Sector Performance Report (ASPR) structure was redesigned consistent with PEDP3 results framework and reporting requirements; (iii) the TAundertook the development of the web-based Annual Operational Plan-MIS to improve the planning, management and monitoring processes, etc.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
